str2: With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
From oninemi; profitable; Onesimus, a Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.
